title: No Link Between Autism and Vaccines
cleaned_text: While some people have publicly raised concerns over the years about a possible link between the measles-mumps-rubella (MMR) vaccine and autism spectrum disorder (ASD), numerous studies have found no connection between the 2 (or between any other vaccine and ASD). The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention asserts that immunizations remain a safe, effective way to protect your child against serious diseases. If you have concerns about vaccines, talk about them with your child's doctor. See also ... This message is not intended to provide individual medical advice. Always seek the advice of a physician or qualified healthcare provider for any questions you have about your health or medical condition, your breastfeeding issues and your infant's health.
